page.title: 15RECREATION IN LITTLEPORT
page.content:
There is a{Youth Club}on the village College campus, with special nights for over and under thirteens. Activities include snooker, pool, darts, table tennis, watching TV and playing space invaders, indoor hockey or cricket outdoors. Sweets and drinks can be bought. There is also an open air{swimming {pool}on the same site. It is heated during the summer, but is lined with plastic, which creates problems.
In the{village centre,}there are discos in the Constitution Hall, jumble sales in the Oddfellows Hall, a British Legion Club, a Bingo Hall and a place for the over 60's. There are several public houses, such as the Crown, and the Spade and Becket, where there are leagues for darts etc.
